The State of Alabama:

                  To the Sheriff of Lawrence County Greeting

wheras it has been reppresented to the undersigned an
acting justice of the peace for Said County by the President
and Directors of Tuscumbia Courtland and
Decatur Rail Road Company that it is necessary
to cut + Run their Road through the South East
+ South West quarters of Section 16 in Township 4 and
Range 9 West which is the property of Said Township 
reserved for the benefit of Schools therein and that Said com-
missioners of Said Township + Said Company cannot
agree as to the damages which Said Township will
Sustain by locating Said Road upon part of Said
lands not can they purchase a Sufficiency of
Said land upon which to construct Said Road
and the Said President + Directors having petitioned
me to grant them a warrant in pursuence of the
5 Section of their charter for the purpose of condemn
ing a Sufficienct of Said land for the construction of
Said Road and assessing the damages which Said
company Shall pay therefore and having reppre
Sented that a tract Sixty Six feet in width will be
needed for the construction thereof There are therefore
to command you forthwith to Summon a Jury of Seven
disinterested freeholders of your country to meet upon Said
lands on the 6th day of  May instant who Shall be

Sworn by you to inquire into and assess the damages which said company shall pay to said Township for running said road through these said lands and appropriating a tract sixty six feet in width through the same to the use of said company for fifty years (written above: "so long thereafter by their charter unclear") in which inquiry of damages the said jury shall take into consideration the advantages and disadvantages unclear to said Township by the establishment of said road and give their verdict accordingly which verdict so made by said jury you shall return to the clerk of the County Court of said county at the next term of commissioners court there of for the consideration of unclear court unless the said commissioners of the said 16th section or the said company shall appeal to the current court of said county given under my hand and seal this 1st day May 1833
D. G. Ligow Jr.
Came to hand 2 May 1833  Matt Roberts Graff
By virtue of the foregoing warrant I have summoned Henry Jones Byrd? Lynthicum William Johnson Jos (Joseph) Hill Jos (Joseph) Johnson William Terrill & William Davis good [[unclear] jurors of said county who after being unclear unclear & sworn according to the statute proceeded to go upon the land marked out for the road in presence of William Leigh, BC Burnett, & J Abernathy commissioners of said school & David unclear & M Tarver agents for said company & there made returned under their hands the following verdict to wit

after having examined the land within named
We the jury upon our oath (unclearwritten above) that 
the Tuscumbia Courtland & Decatur Rail Road
company shall pay to the commissioners of
the sixteenth section within named one hundred
twenty dollars for creating said road in 
the south side of said section & we condemn
for the use of said company sixty six feet
through said land for fifty years or so
long thereafter as their charter shall continue
this 6th May 1833
Byrd Linthicum
Wm (William) Johnston
Wm C Terrill
Jos (Joseph) Hill
Henry T Jones
James A Johnson
William Davis
Matt Roberts unclear

(penciled in: Graff 5099)
Recorded in Commission
unclear Court docket
B pages 428, 429
& 430 unclear
John Gregg unclear
